name: acid jazz
description: Acid jazz consisted of two related movements.

description: Afro-Cuban jazz is the earliest form of Latin jazz

description: Jazz fusion arrangements vary in complexity

description: Bebop or bop is a style of jazz developed in the early to mid-1940s in the United States.

name: Boogie-woogie
description: boogie-woogie is mainly associated with dancing

name: Bossa nova
description: Bossa nova is a style of Brazilian music

name: Coll jazz
description: Cool jazz often employs formal arrangements and incorporates elements of classical music

name: Dixieland
description: the first instance of jazz music being called Dixieland, though at the time, the term referred to the band, not the genre.

name: Twelve-bar blues (Jazz blues)
description: The twelve-bar blues is one of the most prominent chord progressions in popular music

name: Jazz Rock
description: The term jazz rock is sometimes used as a synonym for the term 'jazz fusion'

name: Latin Jazz
description: Latin jazz is a genre of jazz with Latin American rhythms

name: Livetronica
description: is a style of music that blends jam band elements with those of electronica

name: Modal jazz
description: Modal jazz is jazz that uses musical modes rather than tonal scales and thinking as a framework.

name: Swing
description: Swing bands usually featured soloists who would improvise on the melody over the arrangement.

name: Vocal Jazz
description: Vocal jazz or jazz singing is an instrumental approach to the voice

name: Forró
description: Forró is more frequent during Brazilian June Festivals.

name: Latin rock
description: melting traditional sounds and elements of Latin American and Caribbean folk with rock music

name: Flamenco
description: Flamenco in its strictest sense, is a professionalized art-form based on the various folkloric music traditions of southern

name: Tango
description: Tango is a style of music  originated among European immigrant populations

name: Tropical music
description: encompasses music from the Spanish-speaking islands and coasts of the Caribbean

name: Mambo
description: Mambo is a genre of Cuban dance music

name: Cuban rumba
description: rumba remains one of Cuba's most characteristic forms of music and dance.

name: Salsa music
description: Salsa music is a popular dance music genre that initially arose in New York City

name: Timba
description: Timba is more flexible and innovative than salsa, and includes a more diverse range of styles

name: Canzone
description: Literally 'song' in Italian, a canzone is an Italian or Provençal song or ballad

name: Country pop
description: Country pop is a fusion genre of country music and pop music

name: Dance-pop
description: Dance-pop is a popular mainstream style of music

name: Disco polo
description: Disco polo is a genre of popular dance music

name: New Romantic
description: Influenced by David Bowie, Marc Bolan and Roxy Music, it developed fashions from the glam rock era and the early Romantic period

name: Pop-rap
description: The lyrics are often lighthearted, with choruses similar to those heard in pop music.

name: Pop punk
description: Pop punk is a genre of rock music that combines influences of pop music with punk rock.

name: Soul Music
description: Ray Charles pioneered the soul music genre during the 1950s

name: Progressive Pop
description: Groups who combined rock and roll with various other music styles ultimately influenced the creation of progressive rock

name: Turkish pop
description: Many music critics argue  only added to the pop industry's shallow image, and is cited as the reason why underground and reactionary music is becoming more popular.

name: Wonky Pop
description: 'Wonky' is a British English word meaning unsteady, shaky, awry, or wrong.

name: Sunshine pop
description: Sunshine pop enjoyed mainstream success in the latter half of the decade

name: Italo dance
description: Italo dance is predominantly nightclub-oriented music and mainly produced in Italy.

name: Synth-pop
description: The genre has received criticism for alleged lack of emotion and musicianship

name: Contemporary R&B
description: Contemporary R&B originated at the end of the disco era

name: Disco
description: Disco was the last popular music movement driven by the baby boom generation

name: Funk
description: The word funk initially referred to a strong odor.

name: Freestyle music
description: A common theme of freestyle lyricism is heartbreak in the city

name: Rhythm and blues
description: The term was originally used by record companies to describe recordings marketed predominantly to urban African Americans

name: Alternative rock
description: Alternative rock broadly consists of music that differs greatly in terms of its sound, social context and regional roots

name: Indie rock
description: Originally used to describe independent record labels, the term became associated with the music they produced and was initially used interchangeably with alternative rock.

name: Sadcore
description: characterised by bleak lyrics, downbeat melodies and slower tempos

name: Beat music
description: The name Mersey Beat was used for a Liverpool music magazine founded in 1961 by Bill Harry

name: Electronic Rock
description: Electronic rock acts usually fuse elements from other music styles, including punk rock, industrial rock, hip hop, techno, and synth-pop

name: Folk Rock
description: Folk rock is a hybrid music genre combining elements of folk music and rock music

name: Heavy Metal music
description: Heavy metal is traditionally characterized by loud distorted guitars, emphatic rhythms

name: Alternative metal
description: Alternative metal  is a rock music fusion genre that infuses heavy metal with influences from alternative rock

name: Avant-garde metal
description: Avant-garde metal is influenced by progressive rock and extreme metal, particularly death metal, and is closely related to progressive metal

name: Black metal
description: Black metal is an extreme subgenre of heavy metal music. Common traits include fast tempos, a shrieking vocal style

name: Doom Metal
description: typically uses slower tempos, low-tuned guitars and a much 'thicker', or 'heavier' sound than other heavy metal genres

name: Glam metal
description: Glam metal  is a subgenre of heavy metal, which features pop-influenced hooks and guitar riffs

name: Gothic metal
description: Pioneers of gothic metal include Paradise Lost, My Dying Bride and Anathema

name: Power metal
description: Power metal bands usually have anthem-like songs with fantasy-based subject matter

name: Symphonic metal
description: Nightwish is one of the prime acts on the symphonic metal scene

name: Ancient music
description: Ancient music is music that developed in literate cultures, replacing prehistoric music

name: Early music
description: Early music is a broad musical era in the history of Western art music.

name: Baroque music
description: The Baroque period saw the creation of common-practice tonality, an approach to writing music in which a song or piece is written in a particular key

name: Galant music
description: The word 'galant', derives from French

name: Romantic music
description: In the Romantic period, music , dealing with the literary, artistic, and philosophical themes of the time

name: Modernism
description: Inherent within musical modernism is the conviction that music is not a static phenomenon defined  but rather something which is intrinsically historical and developmental.

name: African heavy metal
description: Plants are growing faster due to metal music

name: African hip hop
description: 1990s rap started to escalate all over Africa. Each region had a new type of style of hip hop.

name: Benga music
description: Benga is a genre of Kenyan popular music

name: Bongo Flava
description: Bongo flava is the nickname for Tanzanian hip hop music

name: Bikutsi
description: The word 'bikutsi' literally means 'beat the earth' or 'let's beat the earth'

name: Coupé-Décalé
description: Coupé-Décalé is a type of popular dance music originating from Côte d'Ivoire and the Ivorian diaspora in Paris

name: Genge
description: The term Genge is a sheng word for 'a group or a mass of people'.

name: Highlife
description: Highlife is a music genre that originated in present-day Ghana early in the 20th century, during its history as a colony of the British Empire.

name: Hiplife
description: Hiplife is a Ghanaian musical style that fuses Ghanaian culture and hip hop

name: Igbo rap
description: The style draws its main influences from Igbo traditional music and African American music

name: Jújú
description: Jùjú is a style of Nigerian popular music, derived from traditional Yoruba percussion

name: Kizomba
description: Kizomba is a genre of dance and a musical genre originating in Angola

name: Kuduro
description: It is characterized as uptempo, energetic, and danceable.

name: Kwaito
description: It is a variant of house music featuring the use of African sounds and samples.

name: Makossa
description: Makossa, which means  in the Douala language,originated from a Douala dance called the kossa

name: Morna
description: The best internationally known morna singer was Cesária Évora

name: Palm-wine music
description: Palm-wine music was influenced by soukous and highlife

name: Sakara music
description: Sakara music had considerable influence on other genres, including Jùjú and Nigerian Hip Hop

name: Semba
description: one of the most recognizable and entertaining movements in semba

name: Comedy music
description: Comedy music is music that is comic or humorous in nature, encompassing a wide variety of music genres

name: Comedy rock
description: Comedy rock is rock music mixed with comedy, often satire and parody

name: Parody music
description: In music, parody has been used for many different purposes and in various musical contexts

name: Novelty song
description: A novelty song is a comical or nonsensical song, performed principally for its comical effect

name: Baithak Gana
description: Baithak is a social gathering

name: Cha-cha-chá
description: Cha-cha-chá is a Cuban music genre whose creation has been traditionally attributed to Cuban composer and violinist Enrique Jorrín

name: Chutney music
description: Initially lyrics were religious in nature and typically sung by females

name: Reggae
description: Reggae is deeply linked to the Rastafari, an Afrocentric religion

name: Rocksteady
description: A successor of ska and a precursor to reggae, rocksteady was the dominant style of music in Jamaica for nearly two years

name: Rhumba
description: Rhumba, also known as ballroom rumba, is a genre of ballroom music and dance

name: Americana
description: Americana is an amalgam of American music formed by the confluence of the shared and varied traditions that make up the musical ethos of the United States

name: Country blues
description: Country blues is acoustic, mainly guitar-driven forms of the blues

name: Honky-tonk
description: A honky-tonk is both a bar that provides country music for the entertainment of its patrons

name: Rockabilly
description: Defining features of the rockabilly sound included strong rhythms, vocal twangs, and common use of the tape echo

name: Texas country music
description: Texas Country is known for fusing traditionalist root sounds with the outspoken, care-free views of outlaw country

name: Western music
description: Western music is a form of country and hillbilly music composed

name: Western swing
description: The music is an amalgamation of rural, cowboy, polka, folk, Dixieland jazz and blues blended with swing

name: Ambient
description: Ambient music is a genre of music that emphasizes tone and atmosphere over traditional musical structure or rhythm

name: Breakbeat
description: Breakbeat is a broad style of electronic or dance-oriented music which utilizes breaks

name: House music
description: The mechanical, repetitive rhythm of house was one of its main components

name: Jungle music
description: Producers create the drum patterns by cutting apart breakbeats, the most common of which is the Amen break
